intro: Aciotis martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Martinique and nearby islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, aiding in wind pollination and seed dispersal. Aciotis martinicensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
